ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of
ygData.msgSnippet: You got off lucky Galtin ;-)  I woke up the next day and killed my entire party several times in succession before we figured out what was going on. It was
ygData.messageBody:
You got off lucky Galtin ;-) I woke up the next day and killed my entire
party several times in succession before we figured out what was going on.
It was then that we posted that the resist rates had been changed only to
have GZ personally assure us that only mobs over 35th level got the
secondary save. It took 4 months for that lie to be admitted and it has
gotten more bitter ever since.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)
[mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 11, 2000 2:07 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of


Speaking for myself, Lullaby worked a helluva lot better at 18 than it did
at 31. I happen to be one of the bards who got caught in the stealth nerf
of Lullaby so long ago. One day I was saving my party from certain death,
then the stealth nerf goes in, and now instead of saving the party, I save
everyone but myself. So for the few of us still around from release, I know
how useful the song used to be.

Galtin of E'ci

>
>Yeah I made it all the way to 31. Too bad I have a life. My fleibility is
>nowhere what it was at level 18 even.

I'd be interested to read why you think so?

You got Sonorous Clouding, Consonant Chain, Appalling Screen, Song of the
Sirens. I agree, these aren't the best group songs, but all are highly
effective for the solo bard.

What is it at level 18 that you were able to do that you are now unable to
do at 31? (no sarcasm here, I really do want to hear what you think.)

Sincerely,
Windleaf



Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
